title: fdeflate crate build fails with target-cpu=native and Rust 1.70.0

labels.name: A-LLVM
labels.description: Area: Code generation parts specific to LLVM. Both correctness bugs and optimization-related issues.

labels.name: I-prioritize
labels.description: Indicates that prioritization has been requested for this issue

body:
When trying to build the [fdeflate](https://github.com/image-rs/fdeflate) crate with Rust 1.70 and `RUSTFLAGS="-C target-cpu=native"`, there is segmentation fault.
Crate issue: https://github.com/image-rs/fdeflate/issues/6

The segfault seems to happen only in release mode.

### Reproduction steps
```console
git clone https://github.com/image-rs/fdeflate.git
cd fdeflate
RUSTFLAGS="-C target-cpu=native" cargo build --release
```

### Version it worked on

It most recently worked on: 1.69.0

### Version with regression

<!--
Provide the version you are using that has the regression.
-->

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.70.0 (90c541806 2023-05-31)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 90c541806f23a127002de5b4038be731ba1458ca
commit-date: 2023-05-31
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.70.0
LLVM version: 16.0.2
```

<!--
Did the compiler crash? If so, please provide a backtrace.
-->

### Backtrace
[gdb.txt](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/files/11680735/gdb.txt)
